00006 package WeBWorK::PG::ImageGenerator;
00007 
00008 =head1 NAME
00009 
00010 WeBWorK::PG::ImageGenerator - create an object for holding bits of math for
00011 LaTeX, and then to process them all at once.
00012 
00013 =head1 SYNPOSIS
00014 
00015 FIXME: add this

00018 
00019 # Note, this now has the ability to communicate with mysql for storing depths of
00020 # images for alignments.  If you want to provide another way of storing the depths,
00021 # make up another "magic" alignment name, look for explicit mentions of mysql here
00022 # and add statements for the new special alignment name.  Most of the action is
00023 # in the function update_depth_cache near the end of this file.  Also look for the
00024 # place where PG creates a new ImageGenerator object, and possibly adjust there as
00025 # well.
00026 
00027 use strict;
00028 use warnings;
00029 use DBI;
00030 use WeBWorK::Constants;
00031 use WeBWorK::EquationCache;
00032 
00033 # can't use WeBWorK::Utils from here, so we define the needed functions here
00034 #use WeBWorK::Utils qw/readFile readDirectory makeTempDirectory removeTempDirectory/;
00035 
00036 use constant MKDIR_ATTEMPTS => 10;
00037 use File::Path qw(rmtree);
00038 
00039 sub readFile($) {
00040     my $filename = shift;
00041     my $contents = '';
00042     local(*FILEH);
00043     open FILEH,  "<$filename" or die "Unable to read $filename";
00044     local($/) = undef;
00045     $contents = <FILEH>;
00046     close(FILEH);
00047     return($contents);
00048 }
00049 
00050 sub readDirectory($) {
00051     my $dirName = shift;
00052     opendir my $dh, $dirName
00053         or die "Failed to read directory $dirName: $!";
00054     my @result = readdir $dh;
00055     close $dh;
00056     return @result;
00057 }
00058 
00059 sub makeTempDirectory($$) {
00060     my ($parent, $basename) = @_;
00061     # Loop until we're able to create a directory, or it fails for some
00062     # reason other than there already being something there.
00063     my $triesRemaining = MKDIR_ATTEMPTS;
00064     my ($fullPath, $success);
00065     do {
00066         my $suffix = join "", map { ('A'..'Z','a'..'z','0'..'9')[int rand 62] } 1 .. 8;
00067         $fullPath = "$parent/$basename.$suffix";
00068         $success = mkdir $fullPath;
00069     } until ($success or not $!{EEXIST});
00070     unless ($success) {
00071         my $msg = '';
00072         $msg    .=  "Server does not have write access to the directory $parent" unless -w $parent;
00073         die "$msg\r\nFailed to create directory $fullPath:\r\n $!"
00074     }
00075 
00076     return $fullPath;
00077 }
00078 
00079 sub removeTempDirectory($) {
00080     my ($dir) = @_;
00081     rmtree($dir, 0, 0);
00082 }

00126 ################################################################################

00128 =head1 METHODS
00129 
00130 =over
00131 
00132 =item new
00133 
00134 Returns a new ImageGenerator object. C<%options> must contain the following
00135 entries:
00136 
00137  tempDir  => directory in which to create temporary processing directory
00138  latex    => path to latex binary
00139  dvipng   => path to dvipng binary
00140  useCache => boolean, whether to use global image cache
00141 
00142 If C<useCache> is false, C<%options> must also contain the following entries:
00143 
00144  dir      => directory for resulting files
00145  url      => url to directory for resulting files
00146  basename => base name for image files (i.e. "eqn-$psvn-$probNum")
00147 
00148 If C<useCache> is true, C<%options> must also contain the following entries:
00149 
00150  cacheDir => directory for resulting files
00151  cacheURL => url to cacheDir
00152  cacheDB  => path to cache database file
00153 
00154 Options may also contain:
00155 
00156  dvipng_align    => vertical alignment option (a string to use like baseline, or 'mysql')
00157  dvipng_depth_db => database connection information for a "depths database"
00158  useMarkers      => if you want to have the dvipng images vertically aligned, this involves adding markers
00159 
00160 =cut
00161 
00162 sub new {
00163     my ($invocant, %options) = @_;
00164     my $class = ref $invocant || $invocant;
00165     my $self = {
00166         names   => [],
00167         strings => [],
00168         texPreambleAdditions => undef,
00169         depths => {},
00170         %options,
00171     };
00172 
00173     # set some values
00174     $self->{dvipng_align} = 'absmiddle' unless defined($self->{dvipng_align});
00175     $self->{store_depths} = 1 if ($self->{dvipng_align} eq 'mysql');
00176     $self->{useMarkers} = $self->{useMarkers} || 0;
00177     
00178     if ($self->{useCache}) {
00179         $self->{dir} = $self->{cacheDir};
00180         $self->{url} = $self->{cacheURL};
00181         $self->{basename} = "";
00182         $self->{equationCache} = WeBWorK::EquationCache->new(cacheDB => $self->{cacheDB});
00183     }
00184     
00185     bless $self, $class;
00186 }
00187 
00188 =item addToTeXPreamble($string)
00189 
00190 Adds the string as part of the TeX preamble for all equations in the problem.
00191 For example
00192    $rh_envir->{imagegen}->addToTeXPreamble("\newcommand{\myVec}[#1]{\vec{#1}} ");
00193 
00194 Will define a question wide style for interpreting
00195    \( \myVec{v}  \)
00196    
00197 If this statement is placed in PGcourse.pl then the backslashes must be doubled since it is a .pl file
00198 not a .pg file
00199 
00200 =cut
00201 
00202 sub addToTeXPreamble {
00203     my $self  = shift;
00204     my $str   = shift;
00205     $self->{texPreambleAdditions} = $str if defined $str;
00206     $self->{texPreambleAdditions};
00207 }
00208 
00209 =item refresh(1)
00210 
00211 Forces every equation picture to be recalculated. Useful for debugging.
00212     $rh_envir->{imagegen}->refresh(1);
00213 
00214 =cut
00215 
00216 sub refresh {
00217     my $self  = shift;
00218     my $in   = shift;
00219     $self->{refresh} = $in if defined($in);
00220     $self->{refresh};
00221 }
00222 
00223 =item add($string, $mode)
00224 
00225 Adds the equation in C<$string> to the object. C<$mode> can be "display" or
00226 "inline". If not specified, "inline" is assumed. Returns the proper HTML tag
00227 for displaying the image.
00228 
00229 =cut
00230 
00231 sub add {
00232     my ($self, $string, $mode) = @_;
00233     
00234     my $names    = $self->{names};
00235     my $strings  = $self->{strings};
00236     my $dir      = $self->{dir};
00237     my $url      = $self->{url};
00238     my $basename = $self->{basename};
00239     my $useCache = $self->{useCache};
00240     my $depths  = $self->{depths};
00241     
00242     # if the string came in with delimiters, chop them off and set the mode
00243     # based on whether they were \[ .. \] or \( ... \). this means that if
00244     # the string has delimiters, the mode *argument* is ignored.
00245     if ($string =~ s/^\\\[(.*)\\\]$/$1/s) {
00246         $mode = "display";
00247     } elsif ($string =~ s/^\\\((.*)\\\)$/$1/s) {
00248         $mode = "inline";
00249     }
00250     # otherwise, leave the string and the mode alone.
00251     
00252     # assume that a bare string with no mode specified is inline
00253     $mode ||= "inline";
00254     
00255     # now that we know what mode we're dealing with, we can generate a "real"
00256     # string to pass to latex
00257     my $realString = ($mode eq "display")
00258         ? '\(\displaystyle{' . $string . '}\)'
00259         : '\(' . $string . '\)';
00260     
00261     # alignment tag could be a fixed default
00262     my ($imageNum, $aligntag) = (0, qq|align="$self->{dvipng_align}"|);
00263     # if the default is for variable heights, the default should be meaningful
00264     # in an answer preview, $self->{dvipng_align} might be 'mysql', but we still
00265         # use a static alignment
00266     $aligntag = 'align="baseline"' if ($self->{dvipng_align} eq 'mysql');
00267 
00268     # determine what the image's "number" is
00269     if($useCache) {
00270         $imageNum = $self->{equationCache}->lookup($realString);
00271         $aligntag = 'MaRkEr'.$imageNum if $self->{useMarkers};
00272         $depths->{"$imageNum"} = 'none' if ($self->{dvipng_align} eq 'mysql');
00273         # insert a slash after 2 characters
00274         # this effectively divides the images into 16^2 = 256 subdirectories
00275         substr($imageNum,2,0) = '/';
00276     } else {
00277         $imageNum = @$strings + 1;
00278     }
00279     
00280     # We are banking on the fact that if useCache is true, then basename is empty.
00281     # Maybe we should simplify and drop support for useCache =0 and having a basename.
00282 
00283     # get the full file name of the image
00284     my $imageName = ($basename)
00285         ? "$basename.$imageNum.png"
00286         : "$imageNum.png";
00287     
00288     # store the full file name of the image, and the "real" tex string to the object
00289     push @$names, $imageName;
00290     push @$strings, $realString;
00291     #warn "ImageGenerator: added string $realString with name $imageName\n";
00292     
00293     # ... and the full URL.
00294     my $imageURL = "$url/$imageName";
00295     
00296     my $imageTag  = ($mode eq "display")
00297         ? "<div align=\"center\"><img src=\"$imageURL\" $aligntag alt=\"$string\"></div>"
00298         : "<img src=\"$imageURL\" $aligntag alt=\"$string\">";
00299 
00300     return $imageTag;
00301 }
00302 
00303 =item render(%options)
00304 
00305 Uses LaTeX and dvipng to render the equations stored in the object. 
00306 
00307 The option C<body_text> is a reference to the text of the problem's text.  After
00308 rendering the images and figuring out their depths, we go through and fix the tags
00309 of the images to get the vertical alignment right.  If it is left out, then we skip
00310 that step.
00311 
00312 =for comment
00313 
00314 If the key "mtime" in C<%options> is given, its value will be interpreted as a
00315 unix date and compared with the modification date on any existing copy of the
00316 first image to be generated. It is recommended that the modification time of the
00317 source file from which the equations originate be used for this value. If the
00318 key "refresh" in C<%options> is true, images will be regenerated regardless of
00319 when they were last modified. If neither option is supplied, "refresh" is
00320 assumed.
00321 
00322 NOTE: It's not clear to me that mtime has been implemented -- MEG - 2011/06
00323 
00324 =cut
00325 
00326 sub render {
00327     my ($self, %options) = @_;
00328     
00329     my $tempDir  = $self->{tempDir};
00330     my $dir      = $self->{dir};
00331     my $basename = $self->{basename};
00332     my $latex    = $self->{latex};
00333     my $dvipng   = $self->{dvipng};
00334     my $names    = $self->{names};
00335     my $strings  = $self->{strings};
00336     my $depths   = $self->{depths};
00337     $self->{body_text} = $options{body_text};
00338     my $forceRefresh = $self->{refresh} || 0;      # recreate every equation image -- default is do not refresh
00339 
00340     ###############################################
00341     # check that the equations directory exists and create if it doesn't
00342     ###############################################
00343     unless (-e "$dir") {
00344         my $success = mkdir "$dir";
00345         warn "Could not make directory $dir" unless $success;
00346     }
00347     
00348     ###############################################         
00349     # determine which images need to be generated
00350     ###############################################
00351     my (@newStrings, @newNames);
00352     for (my $i = 0; $i < @$strings; $i++) {
00353         my $string = $strings->[$i];
00354         my $name = $names->[$i];
00355         if (!$forceRefresh and -e "$dir/$name") {
00356             #warn "ImageGenerator: found a file named $name, skipping string $string\n";
00357         } else {
00358             #warn "ImageGenerator: didn't find a file named $name, including string $string\n";
00359             push @newStrings, $string;
00360             push @newNames, $name;
00361         }
00362     }
00363     
00364     if(@newStrings) { # Don't run latex if there are no images to generate
00365         
00366         # create temporary directory in which to do TeX processing
00367         my $wd = makeTempDirectory($tempDir, "ImageGenerator");
00368         
00369         # store equations in a tex file
00370         my $texFile = "$wd/equation.tex";
00371         open my $tex, ">", $texFile
00372             or die "failed to open file $texFile for writing: $!";
00373         print $tex $TexPreamble;
00374         print $tex $self->{texPreambleAdditions} if defined($self->{texPreambleAdditions});
00375         print $tex "$_\n" foreach @newStrings;
00376         print $tex $TexPostamble;
00377         close $tex;
00378         warn "tex file $texFile was not written" unless -e $texFile;
00379         
00380         ###############################################
00381         # call LaTeX
00382         ###############################################
00383         my $latexCommand  = "cd $wd && $latex equation > latex.out 2> latex.err";
00384         my $latexStatus = system $latexCommand;
00385     
00386         if ($latexStatus and $latexStatus !=256) {
00387             warn "$latexCommand returned non-zero status $latexStatus: $!";
00388             warn "cd $wd failed" if system "cd $wd";
00389             warn "Unable to write to directory $wd. " unless -w $wd;
00390             warn "Unable to execute $latex " unless -e $latex ;
00391             
00392             warn `ls -l $wd`;
00393             my $errorMessage = '';
00394             if (-r "$wd/equation.log") {
00395                 $errorMessage = readFile("$wd/equation.log");
00396                 warn "<pre> Logfile contents:\n$errorMessage\n</pre>";
00397             } else {
00398                warn "Unable to read logfile $wd/equation.log ";
00399             }
00400         }
00401     
00402         warn "$latexCommand failed to generate a DVI file"
00403             unless -e "$wd/equation.dvi";
00404         
00405         ############################################
00406         # call dvipng
00407         ############################################
00408         my $dvipngCommand = "cd $wd && $dvipng " . $DvipngArgs . " equation > dvipng.out 2> dvipng.err";
00409         my $dvipngStatus = system $dvipngCommand;
00410         warn "$dvipngCommand returned non-zero status $dvipngStatus: $!"
00411             if $dvipngStatus;
00412         # get depths
00413         my $dvipngout = '';
00414         $dvipngout = readFile("$wd/dvipng.out") if(-r "$wd/dvipng.out");
00415         my @dvipngdepths = ($dvipngout =~ /depth=(\d+)/g);
00416         # kill them all if something goes wrnog
00417         @dvipngdepths = () if(scalar(@dvipngdepths) != scalar(@newNames));
00418     
00419         ############################################
00420         # move/rename images
00421         ############################################
00422     
00423       chmod (0664,<$wd/*>);  # first make everything group writable so that a WeBWorK admin can delete images
00424         foreach my $image (readDirectory($wd)) {
00425             # only work on equation#.png files
00426             next unless $image =~ m/^equation(\d+)\.png$/;
00427             
00428             # get image number from above match
00429             my $imageNum = $1;
00430             # note, problems with solutions/hints can have empty values in newNames
00431             next unless $newNames[$imageNum-1];
00432     
00433             # record the dvipng offset
00434             my $hashkey = $newNames[$imageNum-1];
00435             $hashkey =~ s|/||;
00436             $hashkey =~ s|\.png$||;
00437             $depths->{"$hashkey"} = $dvipngdepths[$imageNum-1] if(defined($dvipngdepths[$imageNum-1]));
00438             
00439             #warn "ImageGenerator: found generated image $imageNum with name $newNames[$imageNum-1]\n";
00440             
00441             # move/rename image
00442             #my $mvCommand = "cd $wd && /bin/mv $wd/$image $dir/$basename.$imageNum.png";
00443             # check to see if this requires a directory we haven't made yet
00444             my $newdir = $newNames[$imageNum-1];
00445             $newdir =~ s|/.*$||;
00446             if($newdir and not -d "$dir/$newdir") {
00447                 my $success = mkdir "$dir/$newdir";
00448                 chmod (0775,<$dir/$newdir>); # make the directory group writable so that a WeBWorK admin can delete images
00449                 warn "Could not make directory $dir/$newdir" unless $success;
00450             }
00451             my $mvCommand = "cd $wd && /bin/mv $wd/$image $dir/" . $newNames[$imageNum-1];
00452             my $mvStatus = system $mvCommand;
00453             if ( $mvStatus) {
00454                 warn "$mvCommand returned non-zero status $mvStatus: $!";
00455                 warn "Can't write to tmp/equations directory $dir" unless -w $dir;
00456             }
00457     
00458         }
00459         ############################################
00460         # remove temporary directory (and its contents)
00461         ############################################
00462     
00463         if ($PreserveTempFiles) {
00464             warn "ImageGenerator: preserved temp files in working directory '$wd'.\n";
00465             chmod (0775,$wd);
00466             chmod (0664,<$wd/*>);
00467         } else {
00468             removeTempDirectory($wd);
00469         }
00470     }
00471     $self->update_depth_cache() if $self->{store_depths};
00472     $self->fix_markers() if ($self->{useMarkers} and defined $self->{body_text});
00473 }
00474 
00475 # internal utility function for updating both our internal record of dvipng depths,
00476 # but also the database.  This is the main function to change (provide an alternate
00477 # method for) if you want to use another method for storing dvipng depths
00478 
00479 sub update_depth_cache {
00480     my $self = shift;
00481     return() unless ($self->{dvipng_align} eq 'mysql');
00482     my $dbh = DBI->connect_cached($self->{dvipng_depth_db}->{dbsource},
00483        $self->{dvipng_depth_db}->{user}, $self->{dvipng_depth_db}->{passwd});
00484     my $sth = $dbh->prepare("INSERT IGNORE INTO depths(md5, depth) VALUES (?,?)");
00485     my $depthhash = $self->{depths};
00486     for my $md5 (keys %{$depthhash}) {
00487         if($depthhash->{$md5} eq 'none') {
00488             my $got_values = $dbh->selectall_arrayref('select depth from depths where md5 = ?', undef, "$md5");
00489             $depthhash->{"$md5"} = $got_values->[0]->[0] if(scalar(@{$got_values}));
00490             #warn "Get depth from mysql for $md5" . $depthhash->{"$md5"};
00491         } else {
00492             #warn "Put depth $depthhash->{$md5} for $md5 into mysql";
00493             $sth->execute($md5, $depthhash->{$md5});
00494         }
00495     }
00496     return();
00497 }
00498 
00499 sub fix_markers {
00500     my $self = shift;
00501     my %depths = %{$self->{depths}};
00502     for my $depthkey (keys %depths) {
00503         if($depths{$depthkey} eq 'none') { # we never found its depth :(
00504             ${ $self->{body_text} } =~ s/MaRkEr$depthkey/align="ABSMIDDLE"/g;
00505         } else {
00506             my $ndepth = 0 - $depths{$depthkey};
00507             ${ $self->{body_text} } =~ s/MaRkEr$depthkey/style="vertical-align:${ndepth}px"/g;
00508         }
00509     }
00510     return();
00511 }
